meta.title: What Bitcoin Is
meta.subtitle: Most people just one dimension. Bitcoin is all of them, simultaneously.
meta.completionDesc: Bitcoin has a number of important attributes. Some of these attributes have never existed before, but importantly all of these attributes have never been cohesively combined together; the result is a network protocol that is the ideal money.
meta.completionRelation: This is The Bitcoin Migration — the exodus from an inherently broken monetary network that can't be fixed, to an inherently strong monetary network that can't be broken.
meta.panelIntro: Each circle in this geometry represents a critical dimension of what makes bitcoin the ideal money.
meta.panelIntroSecondary: No previous money, including gold, has achieved even half of these properties simultaneously. Bitcoin achieves all of them.
meta.panelCta: Click the center of any circle to begin

concepts.label: Bitcoin
concepts.desc: Bitcoin is the first and only money to simultaneously achieve every property represented here - properties that no previous money, including gold, has ever accomplished together. Each circle represents one critical dimension. Together they describe what is arguably the most important monetary breakthrough in human civilization.
concepts.relation: Every outer circle flows from and reinforces the center. Bitcoin is not any single property - it is the unprecedented convergence of all of them.

concepts.label: Absolute Scarcity
concepts.desc: There will only ever be 21 million bitcoin - not approximately, exactly. This is the first absolutely scarce monetary asset in human history. Gold expands at ~2% per year; fiat has no limit at all. Bitcoin is a closed system with zero supply response to demand - a foundational breakthrough in the concept of money itself.
concepts.relation: Directly enables Predictable monetary policy and underpins Pure Money status. No issuer can tamper with what is mathematically fixed.

concepts.label: Proof of Work
concepts.desc: Every bitcoin is produced through real energy expenditure that cannot be faked. Proof of work anchors digital scarcity to the physical world - each block is a thermodynamic proof that someone paid a real, unforgeable cost. This is what separates bitcoin from every other digital asset. Gold similarly has proof of work - the difficulty in mining it. Fiat has zero proof of work.
concepts.relation: Anchors Absolute Scarcity to reality. Enables Self-Custody of an asset with genuine production cost, and makes transactions Irreversible.

concepts.label: Digital
concepts.desc: Bitcoin is native to the internet - a bearer instrument that can be teleported anywhere on Earth. No physical money can settle across distance in real time. No digital fiat is a bearer instrument. Bitcoin is digitally conservative: it can move instantly, but it cannot be copied or double-spent. This properly makes it ideal for global trade and final settlement, in minutes - something that has never existed before in human civilization.
concepts.relation: The digital nature makes bitcoin Borderless and enables true Peer-to-Peer settlement across any distance, in real time.

concepts.label: Open Source
concepts.desc: Every line of Bitcoin's code is public. Every transaction, every block, every rule is transparent and verifiable by anyone on Earth. There is nothing about bitcoin that is secret, hidden, or permissioned. When opponents criticize open source, they inadvertently reveal their preference for opacity and control. Importantly, Bitcoin is also "open" to everyone and anyone, globally, everywhere and always.
concepts.relation: Transparency is the basis for being Trustless. Combined with Decentralized enforcement, open source makes the rules unchallengeable.

concepts.label: Decentralized
concepts.desc: Tens of thousands of independent nodes worldwide enforce Bitcoin's rules identically. No headquarters, no CEO, no board of directors. There is no central point of failure to attack, no central authority to capture, and no individual or entity capable of unilaterally influencing the network. Importantly it is relatively inexpensive to run a node; most people can do it. Bitcoin is now vastly more decentralized than any other digital monetary network; there is no competition for this absolutely critical dimension of what makes an ideal money.
concepts.relation: Distribution is what makes bitcoin Antifragile and Censorship Resistant. No single point of failure means no single point of control.

concepts.label: Immutable
concepts.desc: Bitcoin's core monetary policy was fixed at inception and can never change. "The nature of Bitcoin is such that once version 0.1 was released, the core design was set in stone for the rest of its lifetime." — Satoshi Nakamoto. Attempting to change it merely creates a different, inferior network, with opportunity cost for participation in that inferior network. This introduces a game-theory dimension that makes Bitcoin even more impervious and inevitable.
concepts.relation: Immutability ensures Neutral rules and protects Absolute Scarcity. What cannot be changed, cannot be corrupted.

concepts.label: Predictable
concepts.desc: Bitcoin's emission schedule is known with absolute certainty - every coin that will ever exist, and approximately by when. No central bank surprises, no emergency printing, no policy pivots. For the first time in history, you know exactly what the monetary supply will be in 50 years, 100 years, and 1,000 years. If you acquire a share of the monetary network, that share is fixed for eternity. This important property has never existed for any other money in the history of human civilization.
concepts.relation: Flows directly from Absolute Scarcity and Immutable rules. Predictability is the foundation of long-term economic planning.

concepts.label: Self-Custody
concepts.desc: Bitcoin is a true bearer instrument - it can be owned completely, with no dependency on any third party. Self-custody means no rehypothecation risk, no fractional reserve, no confiscation. The trend in bitcoin is toward decentralization and distribution of custody, making state expropriation or even capital controls practically impossible. While self-custody of physical gold is possible, it can be impractical, especially at scale.
concepts.relation: Enabled by Proof of Work security and Digital portability. This is private property on a level never before possible.

concepts.label: No Issuer
concepts.desc: No government, corporation, or individual controls bitcoin's creation or supply. There is no nexus of power that can be captured, corrupted, or lobbied. This eliminates the path to government expediency that destroyed every gold standard in history — in 1914, 1934, and 1971. This property also ensures that Bitcoin is legally recognized as a commodity, just like gold.
concepts.relation: Where Absolute Scarcity meets Proof of Work: the supply is fixed by math, the security by energy. No human issuer is needed — or possible.

concepts.label: Irreversible
concepts.desc: Bitcoin transactions are final settlement - real money changing hands, not promises or credit. This eliminates systemic fraud, chargebacks, and the hidden costs they impose on global commerce. True digital final settlement over the internet has never existed before.
concepts.relation: Enabled by Proof of Work energy expenditure and Digital rails. Irreversibility is what makes bitcoin actual money, not credit.

concepts.label: Borderless
concepts.desc: Bitcoin carries no nation-state affiliation. The ~180 fiat currencies fragment the global economy along political lines, adding pointless friction and uncertainty to every cross-border interaction. Bitcoin is a single, universal language of value that works identically for everyone, everywhere.
concepts.relation: A natural consequence of being Digital and Neutral. A universal monetary language eliminates the absurdity of foreign exchange.

concepts.label: Peer-to-Peer
concepts.desc: Bitcoin enables direct transactions between any two people on Earth with no intermediary required. No bank approval, no processing delay, no denial of service. This restores a direct, human economic relationship that intermediaries have long extracted from.
concepts.relation: Combines Digital portability with Open Source rules anyone can verify. Peer-to-peer is the natural state of honest exchange.

concepts.label: Trustless
concepts.desc: Bitcoin is verified by mathematics, not by trusting people, institutions, or governments. The rules are enforced by code and physics, not promises. This removes the single greatest vulnerability of every previous monetary system: corruptible human nature.
concepts.relation: Made possible by Open Source transparency and Decentralized verification. Trust is replaced by proof.

concepts.label: Permissionless
concepts.desc: No bank account, credit score, or government ID required. Bitcoin is accessible to all 8 billion people on Earth. The ~4 billion unbanked and underbanked globally are no longer excluded from the monetary system by arbitrary gatekeeping.
concepts.relation: Flows from Open Source code and Decentralized infrastructure. When there are no gatekeepers, there are no gates.

concepts.label: Antifragile
concepts.desc: Government bans, media campaigns, exchange failures, attempted forks — every assault on bitcoin has made the network stronger and more resilient. Over 16 years of relentless adversarial testing has proven that what cannot be broken cannot be stopped.
concepts.relation: Emerges from Decentralized architecture. The more distributed the network, the more it thrives under attack.

concepts.label: Censorship Resistant
concepts.desc: No entity can freeze, block, or confiscate your bitcoin. When Canada froze protesters' bank accounts and the U.S. seized Russian deposits, they proved that fiat has a kill switch. Bitcoin has no such vulnerability. Your money is yours.
concepts.relation: The intersection of Decentralized enforcement and Immutable rules. What no single party controls, no single party can censor.

concepts.label: Neutral
concepts.desc: Bitcoin is apolitical and non-sovereign. No nation has special privilege over it. It cannot be weaponized against other nations or their citizens. A good money should be recognized and valued even by your adversaries — otherwise it is merely a nation-state plaything.
concepts.relation: Protected by Immutable rules that cannot favor anyone. Combined with being Borderless, bitcoin is the first truly universal money.

concepts.label: Pure Money
concepts.desc: Bitcoin has no alternative industrial or decorative uses — its value is entirely monetary. Unlike gold, whose price is distorted by jewelry and electronics demand, bitcoin is valued solely for what money should be: a ledger of stored economic energy. It is 100% monetary premium — pure money.
concepts.relation: Where Immutable rules meet Absolute Scarcity: a fixed, unchangeable monetary asset with no value distortion from non-monetary uses.
